newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: SOCCER-PORTUGAL RECALL SOUSA AGAINST NORTHERN IRELAND.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PORTUGAL RECALL SOUSA AGAINST NORTHERN IRELAND.

text.p: Inspirational midfielder Paulo Sousa, only recently back after a six months injury lay-off, was named on Friday in Portugal's squad for a World Cup qualifier against Northern Ireland on March 29.
Sousa has only just returned to his German club side Borussia Dortmund following a leg operation that had kept him out of the game since Euro '96.

He picked up a slight strain in Wednesday's European Cup quarter-final victory over Auxerre but will certainly be fit for the Northern Ireland match if not for his club's clash with Borussia Moenchengladbach this weekend.
Sporting Lisbon midfielder Pedro Martins and defender Chico Fonseca of Salgueiros were two new faces in a squad of 20 that draws half its players from foreign clubs.
Goalkeepers; Vitor Baia (Barcelona, Spain), Rui Correia (Braga)

Defenders; Chico Fonseca (Salgueiros), Paulinho Santos (Porto), Sergio Conceicao (Porto), Oceano Cruz (Sporting), Fernando Couto (Barcelona, Spain), Helder Cristovao (Deportivo Coruna, Spain), Dimas Teixeira (Juventus, Italy), Fernando Nelson (Aston Villa, England), Jorge Costa (Porto).
Midfielders; Pedro Martins (Sporting), Luis Figo (Barcelona, Spain), Paulo Bento (Oviedo, Spain) Rui Costa (Fiorentina, Italy), Paulo Sousa (Borussia Dortmund, Germany).
Forwards; Joao Vieira Pinto (Benfica), Jorge Cadete (Celtic, Scotland), Pedro Barbosa (Sporting), Nuno Gomes (Boavista)
